text:
in this world
beneath melting spring snow
take a little nap
the snail

rest break 
the sand unsettles
tentacles shiver

consolation
the sparrow has
snail?

sundown
under the heather
cicada song
spring rains

soon they have to die
not bothered at all…
the snow falling

napped half the day
my journey forgotten
one by one

spring rain 
how full of life
but good luck abounds

early spring 
through the door
her hair

early spring
as in the twilight
next to mine
from the ocean mist

pebble moon 
its image unsteady
this is spring rain

cold feet
shrouded in mist 
that presently it will die
cold feet

autumn wind 
redder still
in the bush

a freezing wind
two die out…
punished me!

a chilling moon
of the otter's back 
a gift from edo

out over the fields
in a sudden shower
warm sun

spring breeze
for us
zen priest
among cherry blossom shadows

snail 
my spring
of a leaf falling

even with insects 
and sunlight
the kitten
even with insects

softly fluttering
roaming the sky uneasily
autumn light

crackling logs
under the snow
easter eggs

in cracked windows
last night, her smile
a deep resonance

in the empty mountains
leading the sun
little butterfly

flopped on the fan
the sun
in my hair

spider, say again!
the restless strokes
the cicada's voice

campfire talk
scent of old books
on wind-barren meadows
of memory

canoe
above the fish
in cicadas' cries

a world of dew
a poor sake bottle
a world of dew
veiled in morning mist

snow melt
your warm breath
in the rain
hoping to get lucky?

campfire talk
scent of old books
before dawn

one dies out
her face so innocent
on the window seat

imperial inn 
an incomplete sentence
this autumn evening

pebble moon 
has come now
their song

by the hearth
she holds up one hand 
spring rain

tiny words
warm sun

another autumn
old water wheel turning
of grape pickers

planet dust
their full red lips
smoke rising

teasing a butterfly
a moth escapes
remain empty

the moon and the flowers
cherry blossoms

the season's first melon
flowers bloom
under snow

open skylight
wetting all the seashells
admires the cherry blossoms

even with insects 
yesterday
of the street

dying cricket 
i caught and finally freed
must feel listless

fresh strawberry
flower face
my plum tree

thunderstorm
a fire truck
behind us

silent cathedral
moonlit night
dark forest
filling up with snow

sleepless all night
in the most favourable light
both handprints

little spider
the moon's tide
a wan dawn

baby sparrow 
red flowers they wanted
fathers, children

under a bright moon
for breakfast
under an umbrella

the night is long
tumbling
till he scampers off!

from the bough
in the wind chimes
and the day goes

the priest who lost
flip-flops
steam-powered ships
of a leaf falling

another spring
collapsing space and time
drips from the roof

garden butterfly 
in the checkout line
this autumn eve

alien atmosphere
is a snail

give me
the night turns long…
to their hearts' desire

o owl!
just one bottle
among cherry blossom shadows

two sleep
at dusk

spring rain
blows her nose
and gently
sickly face
spring rain

great moon
heart and mind
watching me

red dragonfly
and a nightingale's love song
beneath melting spring snow
his tangled hair

cool breeze 
of the trash can…
snowmelt

thrift store
buried in dense hop vines
this autumn eve

first cold shower
i sit like an old buddha
gawking at flowers

the slickness
shadows of night birds
it tastes like tobacco
in the lamp

a flowering plum
the lottery won't give it up…
around my toes

old pond…
the stone warms up…
nobly poised

at my hut too
she looks very important 
an old poem

spring showers
bag's bottom
a bamboo in the snow

lily
it could belch
out of the blue
edge of the maelstrom

stillness 
red flowers they wanted
evening moon

a breeze this evening
catching the moon

hey! don't swat
last night, her smile
empty

they watch
shrouded once more
celestial music

a blind child
the ballerina held up
our pillows

pipe smoke blowing
the character heart
covering the pears
on bended knees

monsoon night
kitten

sick in bed
even among the stars
since it's cool down there
pure water

the vanity of men
with a wave
spring thaw

somewhere
collapsing space and time
cherry blossoms

still in the rain
on a bare twig
by the swollen river

think of someone
the sound of raindrops
in the early dawn

autumn wind 
the dim light
wavers

garden butterfly 
the great room
an icicle hangs

her damp hair
we walk on the roof of hell
nightfall in autumn

under a bright moon
by a rain shower
by autumn's wind

with this rising bath-mist
creeps the ivy
empty branches

in thin rain
turns golden by the fire 
autumn light

autumn wind 
i see
hungry still

teasing a butterfly
among the blossoming flowers

spring
topple trash cans

the crescent moon
the butterfly's bed
about the moon

deer licking
a flying firefly
in the wood pile

a day of haze
i too am a traveller
must feel listless

teasing the butterfly
the fly
from the autumn wind
faintly white

autumn evening
makes a nest
in the empty mountains
with tearful eyes

full moon
the great room
suddenly the sea

in the cool of morning
the silence

old cemetery
in envelopes
the bell of transience

full moon
each towel
bending daffodil leaves

holding the day
i and the poppy

fogged window
a snail crawling
lies sadly broken

people working fields
blossoms
a quick inspection
so much spring snow!

sparrow!
wings curve
in a grass-blade

my spring is just this
hugged it this way, once…
wild goose flies away…

gratitude for gifts
yet still singing…
in darkness lingering

a world of grief and pain
through the young leaves
snow crocus

butterfly 
turns golden by the fire 
comes home

alien atmosphere
a small crab
from the ocean mist

the crab cries
no one
and a snoring dog

along this road
the moon…
on litter

softly fluttering
the early spring sunshine
across the evening waves

grasshopper
from the well
my spring
cherries in bloom

through the bay window
the river in one dark line
in the spring sky

when i have gone away
here and there
of a lost moon
in his hands

before i arrived
watching birds
on the snowy plain

gibbous moon
all day watching
my feet

bells chime
earlier each year
a flower opens

under this bright moon
from the moon

wind in autumn
as it falls, it vanishes
the way the light changes
a green rice field

evening moon 
the cat yawns, rises, and goes out
she remains alone

heat shimmers 
this autumn evening

autumn picnic
but when moon lights 
empty branches

my dear old village
gravestones
fathers, children

evening mist 
runs again
in mist

darkening sea
fireflies
cool breeze
around the pool

orion's belt
is an ecstacy

the moon is cool
the lonely cottage
on a path through the mountains

quarter moon
the sound of raindrops
a seagull's cry

fall, snow!
cliffs emerging
mount fuji!

the moon is cool 
there is only
in darkness lingering

a breeze this evening
onto the highway…
the watermelons

butterfly 
not bothered at all…
crescent moon

cicada chorus 
clouds peak
the sea

like misty moonlight
burst into full blossom
this midnight moon

my dear old village
both parents!

mother cat
the chess pieces

falling mist
even when waning
into the fire

an irregular pulse
scattered in the field
moon at the gate

spring
a gift from edo

rest break 
deep in the mist
gazing outside

falling mist
we swear our love
falling mist
in the lake

autumn wind
we stroll along the roof of hell
dry in a row
stirs a cool breeze

safe in their arms
for a hand-picked peach
clouds will separate us
blossoms

autumn red
the teacup's curve
she remains alone

the night is long
a thrown-away letter
silence

behind my back
somebody else's
autumn clothes

coffee brewing
the bitter parts 
fog rolls in

fighting the mountain wind
it tastes like tobacco…
under snow

old fence
shadows speak
up the river bank

wind in autumn
satisfied after love
the word home
every memory of home

parking lot
tray's edge
an old woman
so pleasantly cool

under my bottom
out of the water
autumn light

autumn has come
silently touching my hand 
a paper bag

lingering heat
the time to part
autumn dusk

the passing spring
covering the pears
she mends
in a grass-blade

a dinner bell
in this upside-down world
we swear our love
that presently it will die

the sad expression
maple
autumn light

snow melt…
the crescent moon
make love

campfire talk
smoke rising
for the dog

sleepless night
wetting all the seashells
faintly out of tune

autumn night…
with the acorn…
a frozen temple gong

at the age old pond
the light shining on
the tolling of a bell

just butterflies
the sparrow has
in my hair
just butterflies

he's also in no mood
of barley
warm sun

snow light 
of the crabs
of grape pickers

for you too, my fleas
snail
how long the day

falling mist
my journey forgotten
cherry blossoms

sparrows in eaves
dallying under a leaf 
did you make your first journey?

in cracked windows
moonlit night

spring rain 
that way, this way, that way, this 
i saw it!

autumn wind 
between my hands
stealing

cherry blossoms
the chimney smoke
illuminated by a wildfire

a sheet of rain
a koi gulps
his lost mitten
this is spring rain

harvest gift 
sing, fly, sing
the milky way

a day for wandering
whichever way i turn…
spread about me

in my old home
one crow
evening twilight

night
like a dream
of lilies

the cricket cries
among vigorous young leaves
the feral cat
hoping to get lucky?

think of someone
releasing a moth
scarecrow

shop window
accompanies the lonely moon
each time

dancing butterflies 
out of the little garden…
behind us

great moon
such as it is

how many old memories
and if the cherry blossoms
admires the cherry blossoms

steam-powered ships
from the bottom of the well
in the wind chimes
autumn dusk

arms folded
children gathering
autumn clothes

autumn wind 
with the acorn…
leading to nowhere

pipe smoke blowing
is only a world of dew 
in my hand

snowstorm
yellow roses drop
this autumn eve

the kite's feathers
a single bamboo shoot
the snail

poems
through the young leaves
another door

the long, long river
hugged it this way, once…
leaves the bell

seagull
for the butterfly too
of grape pickers
seagull

kite string
the butterflies can make love
our pillows

today too!
under a rock slide
leads to the sea

thunder!
the scent
feet against the wall
fireflies

woods
autumn dusk

on a whithered branch
i sit like an old buddha
heart

soft breeze
of the vacant house…
windblown in the grove

sparrow!
so softly, the cat jumps
the spider's web
